home.randomTip: Drink water throughout the day to boost your metabolism and maintain high energy levels.
home.startOnboarding: Let's start your journey! Answer a few questions so we can personalize your nutrition program.

nutritionGoals.title: Nutrition Goals
nutritionGoals.subtitle: Personalized nutrition goals based on your needs.
nutritionGoals.pleaseWait: Please wait a moment while we calculate your personal goals.
nutritionGoals.bmrDescription: Calories your body burns at rest
nutritionGoals.waterTip: Tip: Distribute your water intake throughout the day to stay optimally hydrated.
nutritionGoals.proteinDescription: Proteins are the building blocks of your muscles and important for tissue repair and growth.
nutritionGoals.proteinBenefit2: Promotes satiety and helps with weight control
nutritionGoals.proteinBenefit3: Important for enzymes, hormones, and immune function
nutritionGoals.carbsDescription: Carbohydrates are your main energy source, especially for brain and intense physical activity.
nutritionGoals.carbsBenefit3: Spare protein for muscle building and maintenance
nutritionGoals.fatDescription: Healthy fats are essential for hormone production, cell health, and absorption of fat-soluble vitamins.
nutritionGoals.fatBenefit2: Important for brain health and cognitive function
nutritionGoals.fatBenefit3: Helps absorb vitamins A, D, E, and K
nutritionGoals.waterDetailDescription: Water is crucial for almost all body functions, from temperature regulation to nutrient absorption.
nutritionGoals.waterBenefit1: Regulates body temperature and blood pressure
nutritionGoals.macroDescription: This distribution of macronutrients is optimal for your goal. Proteins help maintain muscle, carbohydrates provide energy, and fats are important for hormones and cell health.
nutritionGoals.mealFrequencyDescription: Recommended number of meals per day
nutritionGoals.hydrationTip: Tip: Distribute your water intake throughout the day to stay optimally hydrated.
nutritionGoals.mealPrepDescription: Prepare meals in advance to save time and make healthier choices
nutritionGoals.highProteinDescription: Focus on protein-rich foods to build muscle and promote satiety
nutritionGoals.volumeEatingDescription: Choose foods with low calorie density to eat larger portions
nutritionGoals.calorieTrackingDescription: Track your calorie intake to reach your weight goal
nutritionGoals.calorieDeficitDescription: Aim for a moderate calorie deficit of 500 kcal per day for healthy weight loss
nutritionGoals.proteinIntakeDescription: Keep your protein intake high ({{proteinGoal}}g) to maintain muscle mass during weight loss
nutritionGoals.calorieSurplusDescription: Aim for a moderate calorie surplus of 300-500 kcal per day for muscle building
nutritionGoals.proteinForMuscleDescription: Consume sufficient protein ({{proteinGoal}}g) for optimal muscle growth
nutritionGoals.frequentMealsDescription: Distribute your calories across 4-6 meals per day to support your metabolism
nutritionGoals.postWorkoutNutritionDescription: Consume protein and carbohydrates after training to promote recovery
nutritionGoals.stayHydratedDescription: Drink at least {{waterIntake}} liters of water daily, especially on training days
nutritionGoals.lowIntensityActivityDescription: Add light activities like walking or stretching to increase your calorie expenditure
nutritionGoals.moderateIntensityActivityDescription: Integrate moderate activities like cycling or swimming for optimal results
nutritionGoals.highIntensityActivityDescription: Use high-intensity training sessions to boost your metabolism
nutritionGoals.breakfastLoseWeightDescription: Protein-rich breakfast with eggs and vegetables (approx. 300-400 kcal)
nutritionGoals.lunchLoseWeightDescription: Lean protein with vegetables and complex carbohydrates (approx. 400-500 kcal)
nutritionGoals.dinnerLoseWeightDescription: Light dinner with protein and vegetables (approx. 300-400 kcal)
nutritionGoals.snacksLoseWeightDescription: Protein-rich snacks like yogurt, nuts, or cottage cheese (approx. 150-200 kcal)
nutritionGoals.breakfastGainWeightDescription: Calorie-rich breakfast with eggs, oatmeal, and fruits (approx. 600-700 kcal)
nutritionGoals.lunchGainWeightDescription: Substantial lunch with plenty of protein, carbohydrates, and healthy fats (approx. 700-800 kcal)
nutritionGoals.snacksGainWeightDescription: Calorie-rich snacks like smoothies, nuts, or protein shakes (approx. 300-400 kcal)
nutritionGoals.breakfastMaintainDescription: Balanced breakfast with protein, carbohydrates, and healthy fats (approx. 400-500 kcal)
nutritionGoals.lunchMaintainDescription: Balanced lunch with lean protein, vegetables, and carbohydrates (approx. 500-600 kcal)
nutritionGoals.dinnerMaintainDescription: Light dinner with protein and vegetables (approx. 400-500 kcal)
nutritionGoals.snacksMaintainDescription: Healthy snacks like fruit, yogurt, or nuts (approx. 200-300 kcal)

water.goalReachedDesc: +30 XP for reaching your daily water goal!
water.missionCompletedDesc: You have reached your daily water goal.
water.goalReachedAgainDesc: Well done! You have reached your daily water goal.
water.resetDesc: Your water consumption has been reset.
water.title: Water Tracking
water.subtitle: Track your daily water consumption and stay hydrated.

morning.title: Morning Hydration
morning.desc: Drink a glass of water right after waking up to boost your metabolism.

dehydration.title: Signs of Dehydration
dehydration.desc: Watch for signs like headaches or fatigue that may indicate dehydration.

workout.title: Before and After Exercise
workout.desc: Drink water before, during, and after workouts to improve performance.

backup.title: Backup & Restore
backup.backupInfo: Create a backup of your data to save it or transfer it to another device.
backup.restoreInfo: Restore your data from a backup. You can choose which data to import.
backup.dataIncluded: The following data will be backed up:
backup.whatToImport: What would you like to import?
backup.backupSuccessDesc: Your data has been successfully backed up.
backup.backupErrorDesc: An error occurred while creating the backup.
backup.fileLoadSuccessDesc: The backup file has been successfully loaded.
backup.fileLoadErrorDesc: The file could not be loaded. Is it a valid backup file?
backup.importSuccessDesc: Your data has been successfully imported.
backup.importErrorDesc: An error occurred while importing the data.
backup.autoBackupDesc: Let NutriCoach automatically create regular backups of your data.
backup.autoBackupWarning: Automatic backups are stored locally on your device. If you clear your browser cache, these backups will be lost.
backup.settingsSavedDesc: Your backup settings have been saved.
backup.settingsErrorDesc: Your settings could not be saved.
backup.keepBackupsInfo: The oldest backups will be automatically deleted when the maximum number is reached.

notFound.title: Page Not Found
notFound.message: The page you requested does not exist.

foodDatabase.importJsonDescription: Import foods from a JSON file into the database.
foodDatabase.jsonFormatHelp: File should contain a JSON array of foods or an object with a "foods" array.
foodDatabase.pleaseEnterDataOrUploadFile: Please enter data or upload a file

protein.title: Protein
protein.description: Proteins are the building blocks of your body and support muscle building and regeneration. They also help keep you feeling full longer.
protein.benefit3: Helps with tissue repair and recovery

carbs.title: Carbohydrates
carbs.description: Carbohydrates are your primary energy source, especially for intense physical activities and brain functions.
carbs.benefit2: Supports brain function and cognitive performance
carbs.benefit3: Saves protein for muscle building instead of energy production

fats.title: Fats
fats.description: Healthy fats are essential for hormone production, cell health, and the absorption of fat-soluble vitamins.
fats.benefit2: Promotes brain health and cognitive function
fats.benefit3: Helps with the absorption of vitamins A, D, E, and K
fats.source3: Olive oil and other plant oils
fats.source5: Eggs and full-fat dairy in moderation

water.title: Water
water.description: Water is vital for all body functions, from digestion to temperature regulation.

updates.updateDescription: A new version of the app is available. Please update to get the latest features and improvements.
updates.reloadInfo: The page will reload shortly to apply the update.
updates.newVersion: A new version of the app is available

loading.appStarting: Your personal nutrition coach is starting

footer.credits: by Marsel Nenaj - Cody by Cursor with Claude 3.7 Sonnet

tips.mealPrepDesc: Plan and prepare your meals in advance to avoid impulse decisions and better adhere to your nutrition goals.
tips.highProteinDietDesc: Proteins keep you fuller longer and help maintain muscle mass during a diet. Try to incorporate protein in every meal.
tips.volumeEatingDesc: Fill your plate with voluminous, low-calorie vegetables and protein to feel full without consuming too many calories.
tips.calorieDenseDesc: Incorporate calorie-dense but nutrient-rich foods like nuts, avocados, and healthy oils into your diet.
tips.frequentMealsDesc: Try eating 4-6 smaller meals per day to meet your calorie needs if you have trouble eating enough.
tips.postWorkoutNutritionDesc: Consume a combination of protein and carbohydrates within 30-60 minutes after training to promote recovery.
tips.stayHydratedDesc: Drink at least {{amount}} liters of water daily, especially on training days, to perform optimally.

general.title: Balanced Nutrition
general.description: Focus on a balanced diet with plenty of whole foods, vegetables, fruits, lean protein, and healthy fats.

lose.title: Calorie Deficit
lose.description: A moderate calorie deficit of about 500 kcal per day leads to healthy weight loss of about 0.5 kg per week. Your goal is {{calorieGoal}} kcal daily.

protein.title: High Protein Intake
protein.description: Increase your protein intake to {{proteinGoal}}g daily to maintain muscle mass and promote satiety.

gain.title: Calorie Surplus
gain.description: A moderate calorie surplus of about 500 kcal per day supports muscle building. Your goal is {{calorieGoal}} kcal daily.

protein.title: High Protein Intake
protein.description: Consume about {{proteinGoal}}g protein daily to optimally support muscle building.

maintain.title: Energy Balance
maintain.description: For weight maintenance, you should consume about {{calorieGoal}} kcal daily, which matches your total energy needs.

active.title: Sports Nutrition
active.description: Meal timing is important. Try to eat complex carbohydrates before training and a combination of protein and carbohydrates afterward for optimal recovery.

bmr.title: Basal Metabolic Rate (BMR)
bmr.description: The basal metabolic rate is the amount of energy your body needs at complete rest to maintain vital functions.
bmr.formula: We use the Harris-Benedict formula, which considers gender, weight, height, and age:
bmr.exampleMale: For men: 66.5 + (13.75 × WEIGHT kg) + (5.003 × HEIGHT cm) - (6.755 × AGE years) = BMR kcal
bmr.exampleFemale: For women: 655.1 + (9.563 × WEIGHT kg) + (1.85 × HEIGHT cm) - (4.676 × AGE years) = BMR kcal

tdee.title: Total Daily Energy Expenditure (TDEE)
tdee.description: The total daily energy expenditure takes into account your daily activity and indicates how many calories you burn in total.
tdee.example: BMR kcal × Activity Factor = TDEE kcal

calorieGoal.title: Calorie Goal
calorieGoal.description: Your daily calorie goal is based on your total energy expenditure and your weight goal.

burnCalorieGoal.title: Calories to Burn
burnCalorieGoal.description: The number of calories you should burn daily through movement and exercise.

protein.title: Protein Goal
protein.description: Protein is important for muscle building and maintenance. Your protein needs depend on your body weight.

fat.title: Fat Goal
fat.description: Healthy fats are important for hormone production and cell health. We calculate 30% of your total calories as fat.

carbs.title: Carbohydrate Goal
carbs.description: Carbohydrates are your main energy source. We calculate them as the remaining calories after protein and fat.
carbs.formula: (Calorie Goal - Protein calories - Fat calories) ÷ 4 kcal/g
carbs.example: (CALORIES kcal - PROTEIN g × 4 kcal/g - FAT g × 9 kcal/g) ÷ 4 kcal/g = TARGET g carbohydrates

water.title: Water Goal
water.description: Adequate water is important for all body functions. We calculate 35ml per kg body weight plus an activity bonus.
water.example: 35ml × WEIGHT kg = ML ml ≈ LITERS liters

breakfast.title: Log Breakfast
breakfast.description: Log your breakfast to start the day healthy

lunch.title: Log Lunch
lunch.description: Log your lunch to track your nutrition

dinner.title: Log Dinner
dinner.description: Log your dinner to complete the day

water.title: Drink Water
water.description: Drink enough water for optimal hydration
water.missionCompletedDesc: You have reached your daily water goal.

protein.title: Reach Protein Goals
protein.description: Reach your daily protein goal for 5 days

weight.title: Log Weight
weight.description: Log your weight once a week to track your progress
